attribute.name: attributes
attribute.description: The list of attributes of your concept.

concept.name: prototype concept
concept.description: A prototype creates a base skeleton to provide reusability and extension to concepts of the model. Any concept can reuse a prototype and would inherit its structure.

concept.name: concrete concept
concept.description: A concrete concept represents the model's actual concepts. Projections can be defined against its structure.

attribute.name: required
attribute.description: The value indicating whether the structure is required for the parent concept.

attribute.name: target
attribute.description: The target concept of the attribute structure.

attribute.name: values
attribute.description: The list of string values accepted by the string instance.

attribute.name: min
attribute.description: Defines the minimum number of characters the user must input. This must be an integer value 0 or higher. If no minlength is specified, or an invalid value is specified, the input has no minimum length.

attribute.name: max
attribute.description: Defines the maximum number of characters the user can input. This must be an integer value 0 or higher. If no maxlength is specified, or an invalid value is specified, the input has no maximum length.

attribute.name: min
attribute.description: Defines the minimum value the user may input. This must be a positive integer lower or equal to the minimum value if specified. If no minimum is specified, or an invalid value is specified, the number has no minimum value restriction.

attribute.name: max
attribute.description: Defines the maximum value the user may input. This must be positive integer greater or equal to the minimum value if specified. If no minimum is specified, or an invalid value is specified, the number has no minimum value restriction.

attribute.name: min
attribute.description: Defines the minimum number of elements for the set. This must be a positive integer lower or equal to the maximum value if specified. If no minimum is specified, or an invalid value is specified, the set will use a minimum of 1

attribute.name: max
attribute.description: Defines the maximum number of elements for the set. This must be positive integer greater or equal to the minimum value if specified. If no minimum is specified, or an invalid value is specified, the set has no maximum value restriction.
